thread.title: Women's Basketball Defeats Clarkson - Kalamazoo College Athletics
thread.title_full: Women's Basketball Defeats Clarkson - Kalamazoo College Athletics

title: Women's Basketball Defeats Clarkson - Kalamazoo College Athletics
text: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla. - The Kalamazoo College women's basketball team wrapped up its trip to Florida with a 57-44 win over Clarkson University on Thursday. Kalamazoo led 13-7 after the first quarter and 33-21 at halftime. Clarkson opened the second half with 10 straight points to cut the deficit to two (33-31), but the Hornets scored the next eight to lead 41-31 at the end of the third. Kalamazoo, which never trailed in the contest, outscored Clarkson 16-13 in the fourth to seal the win. Kalamazoo shot 36.7 percent overall while holding Clarkson to 24.6 percent. The Hornets made 6-of-15 from three-point range compared to 5-of-23 by the Golden Knights. Each team made seven free throws. Kalamazoo outrebounded Clarkson 48-39, with the Golden Knights holding a 14-12 edge on the offensive end. [Sara English](/sports/wbkb/2023-24/bios/english_sara_v08j) led the Hornets with 20 points. The senior scored 11 in the first quarter and nine in the second, finishing the half 6-of-6 from three-point range. [Jordan Wesaw](/sports/wbkb/2023-24/bios/wesaw_jordan_spd2) recorded her first double-double with 18 points and 10 rebounds with four steals. [Kaelyn Arlington](/sports/wbkb/2023-24/bios/arlington_kaelyn_6gwg) finished with eight points and 10 rebounds. [Ruby Hogan](/sports/wbkb/2023-24/bios/hogan_ruby_0rnr) led the team with seven assists. Kalamazoo returns to [MIAA](http://www.miaa.org) play on Wednesday, Jan. 3, at Saint Mary's College.
